alert.note: Alert for Northern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Washington County through 730 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Orwell, or 14 miles north of Whitehall, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Putnam, Wright, Putnam Station and Glenburnie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
